path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/BXC Token Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf

findings.title: Missing Zero Address Validation
findings.description: The contract does not validate against zero addresses, which can lead to unexpected behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Using block.timestamp
findings.description: The usage of block.timestamp can be vulnerable to manipulation by miners.

findings.title: Using suicide
findings.description: The usage of the 'suicide' function can lead to unintended contract behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Using inline assembly
findings.description: The use of inline assembly can make the code harder to read and maintain, and may introduce security vulnerabilities if not used carefully.

findings.title: Unused functions can be removed from Math library
findings.description: average() is the only function that is getting used from Math library so other functions can be removed.

findings.title: Unlocked pragma
findings.description: Contracts are using floating pragma (pragma solidity ^0.8.0 ,^0.8.9 ), Contracts should be deployed with the same compiler version and flags that they have been tested thoroughly.
